unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi is now offering a *buy one, get one free* deal on radiation therapy! Kidding, kidding...mostly. But in slightly less hilarious news, Dr. Rajesh Kumar just published a paper in the Lancet saying that early detection of tumors in Stage 1 & 2 *really* makes a difference.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi is now offering a buy one, get one free deal on radiation therapy! Kidding, kidding...mostly. But in slightly less hilarious news, Doctor Rajesh Kumar just published a paper in the Lancet saying that early detection of tumors in Stage one and two really makes a difference.

unnormalised: Apparently, spotting those pesky little cells early saves a lot of pain, rupee-wise *and* ouch-wise. They found a 60% better survival rate compared to those who waltz in during Stage 3 or 4. I mean, who wants to deal with chemo and radiation when you could just, like, zap it away with a laser pointer? (Okay, I'm exaggerating, but still!).
normalised: Apparently, spotting those pesky little cells early saves a lot of pain, rupee-wise and ouch-wise. They found a sixty percent better survival rate compared to those who waltz in during Stage three or four. I mean, who wants to deal with chemo and radiation when you could just, like, zap it away with a laser pointer? (Okay, I'm exaggerating, but still!).

unnormalised: Speaking of numbers, did you know that India sees over 1.5 million new cancer cases *every year*? That's more than the number of people who think pineapple on pizza is a good idea (and *that's* saying something). This is why catching it before it spreads like wildfire during Diwali is crucial!
normalised: Speaking of numbers, did you know that India sees over one point five million new cancer cases every year? That's more than the number of people who think pineapple on pizza is a good idea (and that's saying something). This is why catching it before it spreads like wildfire during Diwali is crucial!

unnormalised: So, folks, listen up! Don't be shy. Get your check-ups done. Nag your parents to get their check-ups done. Even nag your annoying neighbour...because let's be honest, no one deserves cancer. Seriously. Also, AIIMS is not *actually* doing a BOGO offer, but early screening is *basically* that good of a deal. Think of it as Swasth Bharat's version of a Big Billion Day sale – but for your health!
normalised: So, folks, listen up! Don't be shy. Get your check-ups done. Nag your parents to get their check-ups done. Even nag your annoying neighbour...because let's be honest, no one deserves cancer. Seriously. Also, A-I-I-M-S is not actually doing a B-O-G-O offer, but early screening is basically that good of a deal. Think of it as Swasth Bharat's version of a Big Billion Day sale – but for your health!

unnormalised: And for those who *are* dealing with the Big C – stay strong! Modern medicine is like a Bollywood movie these days – full of drama, twists, and hopefully, a happy ending. You got this!
